title: Flowrate and outlet pressure
text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.lines import Line2D


df = pd.read_csv('./solver-out-2023-04-13_151111322_(temp=10C, inc=1).txt')
df.head()

colors = {False:'tab:blue', True:'tab:orange'}

def draw_plot(df_plot, pressureBara, temperatureCelsius):
    print(f'Pressure = {pressureBara} Bara @ {temperatureCelsius}C')
    df_plot = df_plot.dropna()
    df_plot = df_plot[(df_plot['InletPressureBara'] == pressureBara)]
    fig = plt.figure()
    ax = fig.add_subplot()
    ax.scatter(df_plot['InletFlowrateKgps'], df_plot['FluidPressureAtReservoirBara'], c=df_plot['WasTwoPhase'].map(colors))
    ax.set_xlabel('Inlet flowrate')
    ax.set_ylabel('Outlet pressure')

    handles = [Line2D([0], [0], marker='o', color='w', markerfacecolor=v, label=k, markersize=8) for k, v in colors.items()]
    ax.legend(title='WasTwoPhase', handles=handles, bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc='upper left')
    plt.grid()
    plt.show()


draw_plot(df, 69, 10)
draw_plot(df, 77, 10)

Pressure = 69 Bara @ 10C
Pressure = 77 Bara @ 10C

title: No wells
text:
After excluding rows that entered the two phase region, there are two cases where the greatest outlet pressure for an inlet pressure was not at a flowrate of 1 kgps.


Code
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.lines import Line2D

df = pd.read_csv("./dt/solver-out-2023-04-13_151111322_(temp=10C, inc=1).txt")
df = df.loc[df["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"] > 0.01]
noTwoPhase = df.loc[df["WasTwoPhase"] == False]

grouped = noTwoPhase.groupby("InletPressureBara")
maxFR = noTwoPhase.loc[
    noTwoPhase.groupby("InletPressureBara")["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"].idxmax()
]
maxFR.loc[maxFR["InletFlowrateKgps"] > 1]









InletPressureBara
InletFlowrateKgps
InletTemperatureCelsius
ReservoirPressureBara

Code
colors = {False: "tab:blue", True: "tab:orange"}


def draw_plot(df_plot, pressureBara, temperatureCelsius):
    df_plot = df_plot.dropna()
    df_plot = df_plot[(df_plot["InletPressureBara"] == pressureBara)]
    fig = plt.figure()
    ax = fig.add_subplot()
    ax.scatter(
        df_plot["InletFlowrateKgps"],
        df_plot["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"],
        c=df_plot["WasTwoPhase"].map(colors),
    )
    ax.set_xlabel("Inlet flowrate")
    ax.set_ylabel("Outlet pressure")

    handles = [
        Line2D(
            [0], [0], marker="o", color="w", markerfacecolor=v, label=k, markersize=8
        )
        for k, v in colors.items()
    ]
    ax.legend(
        title="WasTwoPhase", handles=handles, bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left"
    )
    plt.grid()
    plt.show()




Code
draw_plot(df, 69, 10)





Figure 1: No well - 69 Bara, 10°C






Code
draw_plot(df, 77, 10)





Figure 2: No well - 77 Bara, 10°C
GitHub

title: No wells
text:
After excluding rows that entered the two phase region, there are two cases where the greatest outlet pressure for an inlet pressure was not at a flowrate of 1 kgps.


Code
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.lines import Line2D

df = pd.read_csv("./dt/solver-out-2023-04-13_151111322_(temp=10C, inc=1).txt")
df = df.loc[df["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"] > 0.01]
noTwoPhase = df.loc[df["WasTwoPhase"] == False]

grouped = noTwoPhase.groupby("InletPressureBara")
maxFR = noTwoPhase.loc[
    noTwoPhase.groupby("InletPressureBara")["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"].idxmax()
]
maxFR.loc[maxFR["InletFlowrateKgps"] > 1]

Code
colors = {False: "tab:blue", True: "tab:orange"}


def draw_plot(df_plot, pressureBara, temperatureCelsius):
    df_plot = df_plot.dropna()
    df_plot = df_plot[(df_plot["InletPressureBara"] == pressureBara)]
    fig = plt.figure()
    ax = fig.add_subplot()
    ax.scatter(
        df_plot["InletFlowrateKgps"],
        df_plot["FluidPressureAtReservoirBara"],
        c=df_plot["WasTwoPhase"].map(colors),
    )
    ax.set_xlabel("Inlet flowrate")
    ax.set_ylabel("Outlet pressure")

    handles = [
        Line2D(
            [0], [0], marker="o", color="w", markerfacecolor=v, label=k, markersize=8
        )
        for k, v in colors.items()
    ]
    ax.legend(
        title="WasTwoPhase", handles=handles, bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left"
    )
    plt.grid()
    plt.show()




Code
draw_plot(df, 69, 10)





Figure 1: No well - 69 Bara, 10°C






Code
draw_plot(df, 77, 10)





Figure 2: No well - 77 Bara, 10°C

title: No wells
text:
Two phase and discontinuities
There is often, but not always, an outlet pressure discontinuity in cases that have entered the two phase region at or before the final pipe segment.
In Figure 3, the discontinuity is early in the set of cases that entered two phase.


Code
draw_plot(df, 80, 10)





Figure 3: No well - 80 Bara, 10°C




Despite entering two phase, there was no discontinuity in Figure 4. It doesn’t seem to be the case that just entering the two phase region will cause a discontinuity. It could be related to where it happens, from which direction, or what pressure it happens at.
